androidApps.name: PEL
androidApps.description: I wrote this game to mess around with modular game components and because it's a simple game that I really enjoyed playing a long time ago. Turned out my modular implementation was way too inefficient to scale to any sort of larger game but was worth a try

androidApps.name: Drinking Buddy
androidApps.description: This app was supposed to help with calculating how drunk you are but it was difficult to keep the accuracy up. Might have been a decent app if I spent the time to add more features or heavily localise it to the way people drink in different countries

androidApps.name: Splatballs wallpaper
androidApps.description: Splatballs was a java browser game that I wrote so long ago I no longer have the code for. I made this wallpaper to emulate the paint splats that I created for the game. Really didn't take long to make but somehow felt a little bit flat as a wallpaper

iOSApps.name: Sydney Beer Guide
iOSApps.description: An app to consolidate all the information I've collected over the years about the Sydney craft beer scene. Focuses on providing information over a highly customised UI.

iOSApps.name: Phringly
iOSApps.description: This was a request to be able to make these rotated images. It's a very simple app that does one thing well. The idea came from a post on reddit where someone wanted to make this exact kind of image.

flashApps.name: Swarmers
flashApps.description: The first flash game I wrote after moving away from Java. Very simple concept that probably could have done well if it was a bit more refined and had something extra to make it a little more fun. The sound especially was a big mistake

flashApps.name: Swarmers 2
flashApps.description: A sequel to the originl with more levels and features. Didn't really expand the gameplay enough to keep it interesting though. This is a good example of bulking up a game without really making it more fun. Not sure if anyone ever even finished it

flashApps.name: A.D.A.M
flashApps.description: An experiment with making more hand stlye drawings. It didn't come out particularly nice and the gameplay was not very engaging

htmlApps.name: Skorubrew
htmlApps.description: Site to keep track of all my homebrew recipes. Constantly adding new ones as I strive to brew the perfect beer.

htmlApps.name: Beermoney Balances
htmlApps.description: Chrome and firefox extension to track balances across multiple beermoney sites. If you're involved in the beermoney space then this is a great way to keep track of how well each site is performing for you.

htmlApps.name: Positly
htmlApps.description: Experiment in tracking peoples opinions. Built using the play framework. No longer active after I couldn't get users to stay interested. Was a good learning experience in both Scala website development and the pains of trying to engage users.

htmlApps.name: London housing price map
htmlApps.description: When I first moved to London I generated this map based off data from another website to get a feel for how expensive different areas were. I no longer live in London so haven't been updating this with the latest prices.

htmlApps.name: The big album of beers
htmlApps.description: For a long time I've been taking photos of beer and storing them in facebook. To keep track of what I've had I wrote scripts that pull all of the beers from facebook into a format that is easier to search. It's also a testing ground for any other beer related ideas that I have.
